instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP1V8_S5: What is PP1V8_S5? PP1V8_S5 is a 1.8v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PPVCCSA_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCSA_S0_CPU? Main power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. This is NOT shorted to ground if it has a low resistance â€“ this is a common mistake people make. A chip that requires high power at a low voltage like a CPU or GPU will have a low measured resistance to ground..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
hello <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after water damage near <CHIP>U9500</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7220</CHIP> i was clean and reball this 2.
now at the charger its give 20v but 0.05a without battery.
i notice that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD</SIGNAL> is short on <CAPACITOR>C9504</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9501</CAPACITOR> i was take them both and take out also <CHIP>U9500</CHIP> the dido mode at <CAPACITOR>C9504</CAPACITOR> was 100 but after few second it show 350.
i was put back the <CHIP>U9500</CHIP> and measure again <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD</SIGNAL> is still 350. i didn't put back <CAPACITOR>C9504</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9501</CAPACITOR> and connect the charger again.. on charger 20v and 1.5-2a for few second and drop down to 0.5a and the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD</SIGNAL> again on diode mode 70-100ohm.
ppbus - 12.5
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> -0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S5</SIGNAL> -0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
Allow 10-15s after power removed, to check diode mode.

<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> appears at least in the first few seconds?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 68786, member: 682"]
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> appears at least in the first few seconds?
[/QUOTE]
no.
<CHIP>U9500</CHIP>  can make this problems? i dont have new ic to check. or what board use the same?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: CPU could be now damaged, if you detected liquid spill on VCORE area...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
There is anyway to check or its for sure that the CPU is dead? 
Any other way to check? Can <CHIP>U9500</CHIP> make this problem? If i will replace it its can help?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: The wierd thing is When i reball the <CHIP>U9500</CHIP>(nit always) it give me the right V (20)and A(2) at the charger but when i disconnect and reconnect its gone again. V(20) A(0.05)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
This not an exact science.
We do not have the (automatic) tools used by Apple in the fabrication line.
But liquid sign in CPU power supply is really bad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: there is any other things that i can check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: Is the machine recognized in DFU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 68849, member: 682"]
Is the machine recognized in DFU?
[/QUOTE]
dont know how.
 charger with battery is 19.90V and 1.5A but dead

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
We have several threads about DFU mode; just search the forum.
Too many T2 mahines get T2 corrupted and require DFU restore.

Even if previous post is so short, I don't see any reason to quote it...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
UPDATE:
i was try DFU and RESTORE mode and i get error 35 and 4017, i dont find any info about this error.
right side charger with battery  and without 5v 0.05a
left side charger with battery 19v 1.5a without 19v 0.a

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
Then you still have a problem on right side USB-C area.
Compare diode mode readings on basic points with left side.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: sorry it was the type -c adapter problem(CHINESE :mad:)...both side with battery  20.2V 1.5A without battery its 20V 0.05A.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: Try again DFU with the good charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 69105, member: 682"]
Try again DFU with the good charger.
[/QUOTE]
dont work, the mac turn on directly to RCOVERY mode, but i can access to DFU mode, and i get this errors every time.
DFU MODE: step 4 to 4 installing system- load very fast to the end the error 35.
RESTORE MODE: step 4 to 4 installing system - error 4017 at the beginning .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: <CHIP>U7220</CHIP> likely caused an overvoltage to the CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
<CHIP>U9500</CHIP> (ssd) can caused the problem? there was there water damage... and i didnt put back <CAPACITOR>C9504</CAPACITOR> AND <CAPACITOR>C9501</CAPACITOR> now o put them back i sew that they CRITICAL but when i put them the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD0_SNS</SIGNAL> show 3.3V and at the restore its stuck at "installation system"
how can i know if <CHIP>U9500</CHIP> is o.k or not? i dont find this IC to order new one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
You've mentioned liquid sign at <CHIP>U7220</CHIP> too, in the first post.

Do you get correct voltage at all coils associated with <CHIP>U9500</CHIP>?
We don't really know if T2 needs to talk with CPU to fix the NAND.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
UPDATE:
o.k i was find new water damage on <CHIP>U7370</CHIP> i was clean and replace some components there, i was try again DFU restore but nothing..stuck on installation system and nothing on the screen and no fans.
i was also replaced <CHIP>U7370</CHIP> but still the same.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: That is one of CPU power supplies; bad news...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: dead CPU? HOW CAN I BE SURE?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: Not sure, but liquid sign in that area could be damaged PCH/CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: something that i can check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
You can try heating BGA chips with quality flux.
No need to melt the balls, only burn eventually accumulated crap.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
im suspect <RESISTOR>R7370</RESISTOR> its nit look perfect can you tell me what values i need to get there? 
Without <RESISTOR>R7370</RESISTOR> dido mode
<SIGNAL>CPUSA_ISNS_N</SIGNAL>- 945
<SIGNAL>CPUSA_ISNS_P</SIGNAL>- 1175
<SIGNAL>PPVCCA_ISNS_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>-32 short to ground
<SIGNAL>PPVCCA_CPU_R</SIGNAL>-185

with <RESISTOR>R7370</RESISTOR> ALL SHORT

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
Cannot find <SIGNAL>PPVCCA_ISNS_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> in schematic.

However, do NOT make wrong assumption.
No idea where did you get 32 ohm; but if is on a CPU power rail, that should be correct value.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> sorry

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
Then seems to be good value.
<RESISTOR>R7370</RESISTOR> is only 2 miliohm resistor.
Overvoltage induced there by liquid, could damaged CPU.
